panels.description: Minimum memory that nodes are expected to have free for the given pods to be allocated there on aggregate.
panels.title: Minimum Memory Requested

panels.description: Maximum memory that the given pods are allowed to consume on aggregate.
panels.title: Memory Limits

panels.description: Aggregate of minimum CPU core time that the nodes must have free for the given pods to be scheduled on those machines.
panels.title: Minimum CPU Cores Requested

panels.description: Aggregate of maximum CPU time that the given pods are allowed to consume.
panels.title: Maximum CPU Limits

panels.description: Memory working set bytes over memory usage limit. Brief spikes over 100% are expected due to sampling noise and kernel allocation heuristics.
panels.title: Allocated Memory Usage

panels.description: CPU time use over CPU limit. Brief spikes over 100% are expected due to sampling noise and kernel scheduling heuristics.
panels.title: Allocated CPU Usage

panels.description: Aggregate memory consumed (measured by Working Set Size) by the given pods.
panels.title: Memory Usage

panels.description: Aggregate of CPU cores utilized by the given pods.
panels.title: CPU Usage

panels.description:
Count of memory allocation denials (aka failed malloc()s) over time for the given pods due to memory size limits.

A non-zero number of denials does not necessarily mean that the application is being OOM-killed, but it is severely correlated to it when that application  memory quota is undersized.
panels.title: Memory Allocation Denials

panels.description:
Sum of CPU cores that the given pods asked to be scheduled on for execution but were denied by usage limits.

This graph is useful to detect situations where CPU is being limited during small bursts of activity, which could be causing slow application responses, but the sampling rate is unable to spot those short periods.
panels.title: Denied CPU usage

targets.expr: sum (container_fs_usage_bytes{image!="",name=~"^k8s_.*",namespace=~"$namespace",pod=~"$pod",pod=~".*$filter.*"}) by (pod)

options.content: All metrics below sum the data only from the pods filtered above.

panels.description: Sum of all the memory used (Working Set Size) by the given pods for each node on the cluster.
panels.title: Memory Usage

panels.description: Aggregate of CPU cores utilized by the given pods on each node.
panels.title: CPU Usage

panels.description: Count of memory allocation denials (aka failed malloc()s) over time for the given pods due to memory size limits on each node.
panels.title: Memory Allocation Denials

panels.description:
Sum of CPU cores that the given pods asked to be scheduled for execution on but were denied by usage limits on each node.

This graph is useful to detect overcrowded nodes.
panels.title: Denied CPU usage

panels.description: Sum of ephemeral storage usage by the given pods on each node.
panels.title: Ephemeral storage usage
